editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Thompson Family Charitable Trust.

msItem.incipit: Natus in excelsis tectis cartiginis alte | Romanis ducibus
msItem.note: Five lines of verse, introduced by a blue paraph, apparently Terence’s epitaph.

msItem.incipit: Poeta cum primum animum ad scribendum appulit d sibi negocij credidit [fol. 1v, the periocha] Sororem falso creditam meritricule genere andrie glicerium viciat pamphilus grauidaque facta Simo Sosia Dvos istec intro auferte abite sosia ades
msItem.explicit: quod restat Valete plaudite ego calliopius recensui
msItem.author: Terence
msItem.title: Andria
msItem.note: Preceded by the prologue and c. Sulpicius Apollinaris, ‘Periocha’, ed. Robert Kauer and Wallace M. Lindsay, Comoediae, 2nd edn. (Oxford, 1958), unpaginated.

msItem.incipit: Si quisquam est qui placere se studeat bonis quam plurimis [fol. 24, the text] Phedria adolescens Parmeno seruus Qvid ergo faciam Non eam ne nunc quidem cur accersor vltro
msItem.explicit: Ite hac vos valete et plaudite quia ego Calliopius recensui
msItem.author: Terence
msItem.title: Eunuchus

msItem.incipit: Ne cui sit vestrum mirum Cur partes seni poeta dederit [fol. 48, the periocha] In miliciam proficisci natum cliniam amantem antiphilam compulit durus pater [fol. 48v, the text] Cre Me Quanquam inter nos nuper noticia admodum est
msItem.explicit: fiat vos valete et plaudite quia ego calliopius recensui
msItem.author: Terence
msItem.title: Heauton timorumenos
msItem.note: Preceded by the prologue and periocha.

msItem.incipit: Postquam poeta sensit scripturam suam obseruari et aduersarios rapere in peiorem [the text] Mitio [later] Storax non redijt hac nocte a cena eschinus neque seruulorum quisquam
msItem.explicit: habeat in istuc finem faciat Esch Recte M Plaudite Calliopius recensui
msItem.author: Terence
msItem.title: Adelphoe

msItem.incipit: Vxorem duxit pamphilus phylumenam cui quondam ignorans virgini vicium obtulit Prologus Hechira est huic nomen fabule hec cum data est noua [fol. 93v, the text] Philorcium Syra Per pol quam paucos reperias meretricibus
msItem.explicit: feci imprudens quam sciens ante hunc diem unquam Plaudite Calliopius recensui
msItem.author: Terence
msItem.title: Heyra
msItem.note: Preceded by the periocha and two prologues (no break between them). The top half of fol. 92v is blank.

msItem.incipit: Postquam poeta vetus poeta poetam non potest retrahere a studio et tradere [fol. 112, the periocha] Premotis frater abierat peregre demipho relicto athenis antiphone filio Chremes [the text] Dauus Geta Amicus meus et populanis Geta heri
msItem.explicit: Iam faxo huc aderit vos valete et plaudite Quia ego calliopius recensui etc.
msItem.author: Terence
msItem.title: Phormio
msItem.note: Preceded by the prologue and periocha. Fol. iirv is bounded, and fol. iiirv has the top bounding line.

supportDesc.extent: i + 134 (numbered fols. 1–132, ii, iii) + i (numbered fol. iv, pasted to a vellum stub, part of the original book), 274 187

collation.formula: 1–168 178 (–7, a stub with the modern fol. iv now pasted to it; –8).
collation.catchwords: Catchwords at the centre of the leaf.
collation.signatures: All leaves in the first half of each quire were originally signed with a letter and an arabic number, many now cut away; in this system, quires 1–16 = a–r.

layoutDesc.layout: Writing area 148–152 72 presumably in this size so as to facilitate added commentary.
Written in long lines, 25 lines to the page. No prickings; bounded in brown crayon, no rules. Written above top line.

handDesc.handNote: Written in anglicana/secretary heavily influenced by humanistica. Punctuation by point and occasional punctus elevatus and virgula. The same scribe is responsible for our MS 84.

decoDesc.decoNote: No headings. All of the texts are presented as prose.
At the heads of each play, 4-line champes, often with natural scenes within the gold leaf capital.
Demivinets, with gold leaf and flowers at fols. 1 and 71; a floral border at fol. 92v, elsewhere floral sprays.
Texts and scenes introduced by 3-line blue lombards on red flourishing.

binding.p: A modern replacement. Sewn on five thongs. At the front, one modern paper flyleaf; at the rear, one modern paper flyleaf (iv, sewn to the stub following iii).

history.provenance: ‘Sum Ben’ Jonsonij Liber’ (fol. 1 margin). Listed among his five MSS by C. H. Herford and Percy Simpson, Ben Jonson (Oxford: Clarendon, 1925), 1:262–3, along with our MS 192.

source.bibl: Ralph Hanna, A descriptive catalogue of the western medieval manuscripts of St. John's College, Oxford (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2002)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact St John's College Library.
